00004 #include "Csparse.h"

00008 
00009 /* for dgCMatrix  _and_ lgCMatrix and others  (but *not*  ngC...) : */
00010 SEXP xCMatrix_validate(SEXP x)
00011 {
00012     /* Almost everything now in Csparse_validate ( ./Csparse.c )
00013      * *but* the checking of the 'x' slot : */
00014     if (length(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_iSym)) !=
00015         length(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_xSym)))
00016         return mkString(_("lengths of slots 'i' and 'x' must match"));
00017 
00018     return ScalarLogical(1);
00019 }
00020 
00021 /* for dgRMatrix  _and_ lgRMatrix and others  (but *not*  ngC...) : */
00022 SEXP xRMatrix_validate(SEXP x)
00023 {
00024     /* Almost everything now in Rsparse_validate ( ./Csparse.c )
00025      * *but* the checking of the 'x' slot : */
00026     if (length(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_jSym)) !=
00027         length(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_xSym)))
00028         return mkString(_("lengths of slots 'j' and 'x' must match"));
00029 
00030     return ScalarLogical(1);
00031 }

00033 /* This and the following R_to_CMatrix() lead to memory-not-mapped seg.faults
00034  * only with {32bit + R-devel + enable-R-shlib} -- no idea why */
00035 SEXP compressed_to_TMatrix(SEXP x, SEXP colP)
00036 {
00037     int col = asLogical(colP); /* 1 if "C"olumn compressed;  0 if "R"ow */
00038     /* however, for Csparse, we now effectively use the cholmod-based
00039      * Csparse_to_Tsparse() in ./Csparse.c ; maybe should simply write
00040      * an  as_cholmod_Rsparse() function and then do "as there" ...*/
00041     SEXP indSym = col ? Matrix_iSym : Matrix_jSym,
00042         ans,    indP = GET_SLOT(x, indSym),
00043         pP = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_pSym);
00044     int npt = length(pP) - 1;
00045     char *ncl = strdup(class_P(x));
00046     char *valid[] = {
00047         "dgCMatrix", "dsCMatrix", "dtCMatrix", /* 0: 0:2 */
00048         "lgCMatrix", "lsCMatrix", "ltCMatrix", /* 1: 3:5 */
00049         "ngCMatrix", "nsCMatrix", "ntCMatrix", /* 2: 6:8 */
00050         "zgCMatrix", "zsCMatrix", "ztCMatrix", /* 3: 9:11 */
00051 
00052         "dgRMatrix", "dsRMatrix", "dtRMatrix", /* 4: 12:14 */
00053         "lgRMatrix", "lsRMatrix", "ltRMatrix", /* 5: 15:17 */
00054         "ngRMatrix", "nsRMatrix", "ntRMatrix", /* 6: 18:20 */
00055         "zgRMatrix", "zsRMatrix", "ztRMatrix", /* 7: 21:23 */
00056         ""};
00057     int ctype = Matrix_check_class(ncl, valid);
00058 
00059     if (ctype < 0)
00060         error(_("invalid class(x) '%s' in compressed_to_TMatrix(x)"), ncl);
00061 
00062     /* replace 'C' or 'R' with 'T' :*/
00063     ncl[2] = 'T';
00064     ans = PROTECT(NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS(ncl)));
00065 
00066     slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_DimSym);
00067     if((ctype / 3) % 4 != 2) /* not n..Matrix */
00068         slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_xSym);
00069     if(ctype % 3) { /* s(ymmetric) or t(riangular) : */
00070         slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_uploSym);
00071         if(ctype % 3 == 2) /* t(riangular) : */
00072             slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_diagSym);
00073     }
00074     SET_DimNames(ans, x);
00075     SET_SLOT(ans, indSym, duplicate(indP));
00076     expand_cmprPt(npt, INTEGER(pP),
00077                   INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, col ? Matrix_jSym : Matrix_iSym,
00078                                      INTSXP, length(indP))));
00079     free(ncl);
00080     UNPROTECT(1);
00081     return ans;
00082 }
00083 
00084 SEXP R_to_CMatrix(SEXP x)
00085 {
00086     SEXP ans, tri = PROTECT(allocVector(LGLSXP, 1));
00087     char *ncl = strdup(class_P(x));
00088     char *valid[] = {
00089         "dgRMatrix", "dsRMatrix", "dtRMatrix",
00090         "lgRMatrix", "lsRMatrix", "ltRMatrix",
00091         "ngRMatrix", "nsRMatrix", "ntRMatrix",
00092         "zgRMatrix", "zsRMatrix", "ztRMatrix",
00093         ""};
00094     int ctype = Matrix_check_class(ncl, valid);
00095     int *x_dims = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimSym)), *a_dims;
00096 
00097     if (ctype < 0)
00098         error(_("invalid class(x) '%s' in R_to_CMatrix(x)"), ncl);
00099 
00100     /* replace 'R' with 'C' : */
00101     ncl[2] = 'C';
00102     ans = PROTECT(NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS(ncl)));
00103 
00104     a_dims = INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_DimSym, INTSXP, 2));
00105     /* reversed dim() since we will transpose: */
00106     a_dims[0] = x_dims[1];
00107     a_dims[1] = x_dims[0];
00108 
00109     /* triangular: */ LOGICAL(tri)[0] = 0;
00110     if((ctype / 3) != 2) /* not n..Matrix */
00111         slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_xSym);
00112     if(ctype % 3) { /* s(ymmetric) or t(riangular) : */
00113         SET_SLOT(ans, Matrix_uploSym,
00114                  mkString((*uplo_P(x) == 'U') ? "L" : "U"));
00115         if(ctype % 3 == 2) { /* t(riangular) : */
00116             LOGICAL(tri)[0] = 1;
00117             slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_diagSym);
00118         }
00119     }
00120     SET_SLOT(ans, Matrix_iSym, duplicate(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_jSym)));
00121     slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_pSym);
00122     ans = Csparse_transpose(ans, tri);
00123     SET_DimNames(ans, x);
00124     free(ncl);
00125     UNPROTECT(2);
00126     return ans;
00127 }
00128 
00129 SEXP compressed_non_0_ij(SEXP x, SEXP colP)
00130 {
00131     int col = asLogical(colP); /* 1 if "C"olumn compressed;  0 if "R"ow */
00132     SEXP ans, indSym = col ? Matrix_iSym : Matrix_jSym;
00133     SEXP indP = GET_SLOT(x, indSym),
00134         pP = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_pSym);
00135     int i, *ij;
00136     int ncol = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimSym))[1],
00137         n_el = INTEGER(pP)[ncol]; /* is only == length(indP), if the
00138                                      i-slot is not over-allocated */
00139 
00140     ij = INTEGER(ans = PROTECT(allocMatrix(INTSXP, n_el, 2)));
00141     /* expand the compressed margin to 'i' or 'j' : */
00142     expand_cmprPt(ncol, INTEGER(pP), &ij[col ? n_el : 0]);
00143     /* and copy the other one: */
00144     if (col)
00145         for(i = 0; i < n_el; i++)
00146             ij[i] = INTEGER(indP)[i];
00147     else /* row compressed */
00148         for(i = 0; i < n_el; i++)
00149             ij[i + n_el] = INTEGER(indP)[i];
00150 
00151     UNPROTECT(1);
00152     return ans;
00153 }

00155 SEXP dgCMatrix_lusol(SEXP x, SEXP y)
00156 {
00157     SEXP ycp = PROTECT((TYPEOF(y) == REALSXP) ?
00158                        duplicate(y) : coerceVector(y, REALSXP));
00159     CSP xc = AS_CSP__(x);
00160     R_CheckStack();
00161 
00162     if (xc->m != xc->n || xc->m <= 0)
00163         error(_("dgCMatrix_lusol requires a square, non-empty matrix"));
00164     if (LENGTH(ycp) != xc->m)
00165         error(_("Dimensions of system to be solved are inconsistent"));
00166     if (!cs_lusol(/*order*/ 1, xc, REAL(ycp), /*tol*/ 1e-7))
00167         error(_("cs_lusol failed"));
00168 
00169     UNPROTECT(1);
00170     return ycp;
00171 }
00172 
00173 SEXP dgCMatrix_qrsol(SEXP x, SEXP y, SEXP ord)
00174 {
00175     SEXP ycp = PROTECT((TYPEOF(y) == REALSXP) ?
00176                        duplicate(y) : coerceVector(y, REALSXP));
00177     CSP xc = AS_CSP(x); /* <--> x  may be  dgC* or dtC* */
00178     int order = INTEGER(ord)[0];
00179     R_CheckStack();
00180 
00181     if (order < 0 || order > 3)
00182         warning(_("dgCMatrix_qrsol(., order) needs order in {0,..,3}"));
00183     /* --> cs_amd()  ---  order 0: natural, 1: Chol, 2: LU, 3: QR */
00184     if (LENGTH(ycp) != xc->m)
00185         error(_("Dimensions of system to be solved are inconsistent"));
00186     /* FIXME?  Note that qr_sol() would allow *under-determined systems;
00187                In general, we'd need  LENGTH(ycp) = max(n,m)
00188      */
00189     if (xc->m < xc->n || xc->n <= 0)
00190         error(_("dgCMatrix_qrsol(<%d x %d>-matrix) requires a 'tall' rectangular matrix"),
00191                 xc->m, xc->n);
00192 
00193     /* cs_qrsol(): Tim Davis (2006) .. "8.2 Using a QR factorization", p.136f , calling
00194      * -------      cs_sqr(order, ..), see  p.76 */
00195     if (!cs_qrsol(order, xc, REAL(ycp)))
00196         /* return value really is 0 or 1 - no more info there */
00197         error(_("cs_qrsol failed"));
00198 
00199     /* Solution is only in the first part of ycp -- cut its length back to n : */
00200     {
00201         SEXP nms = getAttrib(ycp, R_NamesSymbol);
00202         SETLENGTH(ycp, xc->n);
00203         if(nms != R_NilValue) {
00204             SETLENGTH(nms, xc->n);
00205             setAttrib(ycp, R_NamesSymbol, nms);
00206         }
00207     }
00208     UNPROTECT(1);
00209     return ycp;
00210 }
00211 
00212 /* Modified version of Tim Davis's cs_qr_mex.c file for MATLAB */
00213 SEXP dgCMatrix_QR(SEXP Ap, SEXP order)
00214 {
00215     SEXP ans = PROTECT(NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS("sparseQR")));
00216     CSP A = AS_CSP__(Ap), D;
00217     css *S;
00218     csn *N;
00219     int m = A->m, n = A->n, ord = asLogical(order) ? 3 : 0, *p;
00220     int *dims = INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_DimSym, INTSXP, 2));
00221     R_CheckStack();
00222 
00223     if (m < n) error("A must have # rows >= # columns") ;
00224     dims[0] = m; dims[1] = n;
00225     S = cs_sqr(ord, A, 1);      /* symbolic QR ordering & analysis*/
00226     if (!S) error("cs_sqr failed");
00227     N = cs_qr(A, S);            /* numeric QR factorization */
00228     if (!N) error("cs_qr failed") ;
00229     cs_dropzeros(N->L);         /* drop zeros from V and sort */
00230     D = cs_transpose(N->L, 1);
00231     cs_spfree(N->L);
00232     N->L = cs_transpose(D, 1);
00233     cs_spfree(D);
00234     cs_dropzeros(N->U);         /* drop zeros from R and sort */
00235     D = cs_transpose(N->U, 1);
00236     cs_spfree(N->U) ;
00237     N->U = cs_transpose(D, 1);
00238     cs_spfree(D);
00239     m = N->L->m;                /* m may be larger now */
00240     p = cs_pinv(S->pinv, m);    /* p = pinv' */
00241     SET_SLOT(ans, install("V"),
00242              Matrix_cs_to_SEXP(N->L, "dgCMatrix", 0));
00243     Memcpy(REAL(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, install("beta"),
00244                            REALSXP, n)), N->B, n);
00245     Memcpy(INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_pSym,
00246                               INTSXP, m)), p, m);
00247     SET_SLOT(ans, install("R"),
00248              Matrix_cs_to_SEXP(N->U, "dgCMatrix", 0));
00249     if (ord)
00250         Memcpy(INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, install("q"),
00251                                   INTSXP, n)), S->q, n);
00252     else
00253         ALLOC_SLOT(ans, install("q"), INTSXP, 0);
00254     cs_nfree(N);
00255     cs_sfree(S);
00256     cs_free(p);
00257     UNPROTECT(1);
00258     return ans;
00259 }
00260 
00261 /* Modified version of Tim Davis's cs_lu_mex.c file for MATLAB */
00262 SEXP dgCMatrix_LU(SEXP Ap, SEXP orderp, SEXP tolp)
00263 {
00264     /* Is currently only called as  .Call(dgCMatrix_LU, x, TRUE, 1)) */
00265     SEXP ans = get_factors(Ap, "LU");
00266     CSP A = AS_CSP__(Ap), D;
00267     css *S;
00268     csn *N;
00269     int n, order = asInteger(orderp), *p;
00270     double tol = asReal(tolp);
00271     R_CheckStack();
00272 
00273     /* FIXME: dgCMatrix_LU should check ans for consistency in
00274      * permutation type with the requested value - Should have two
00275      * classes or two different names in the factors list for LU with
00276      * permuted columns or not.
00277      * OTOH, currently  (order, tol) === (1, 1) always.
00278      */
00279 
00280     if (ans != R_NilValue) return ans;
00281     n = A->n;
00282     if (A->m != n)
00283         error("LU decomposition applies only to square matrices");
00284     if (order) {                /* not using natural order */
00285         order = (tol == 1) ? 2  /* amd(S'*S) w/dense rows or I */
00286             : 1;                /* amd (A+A'), or natural */
00287     }
00288     S = cs_sqr (order, A, 0) ;  /* symbolic ordering, no QR bound */
00289     N = cs_lu (A, S, tol) ;     /* numeric factorization */
00290     if (!N) {
00291         error ("cs_lu(A) failed: near-singular A (or out of memory)");
00292         return R_NilValue; /*-Wall*/
00293     }
00294     cs_dropzeros (N->L) ;       /* drop zeros from L and sort it */
00295     D = cs_transpose (N->L, 1) ;
00296     cs_spfree (N->L) ;
00297     N->L = cs_transpose (D, 1) ;
00298     cs_spfree (D) ;
00299     cs_dropzeros (N->U) ;       /* drop zeros from U and sort it */
00300     D = cs_transpose (N->U, 1) ;
00301     cs_spfree (N->U) ;
00302     N->U = cs_transpose (D, 1) ;
00303     cs_spfree (D) ;
00304     p = cs_pinv (N->pinv, n) ;  /* p=pinv' */
00305     ans = PROTECT(NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS("sparseLU")));
00306     SET_SLOT(ans, install("L"),
00307              Matrix_cs_to_SEXP(N->L, "dtCMatrix", 0));
00308     SET_SLOT(ans, install("U"),
00309              Matrix_cs_to_SEXP(N->U, "dtCMatrix", 0));
00310     Memcpy(INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_pSym, /* "p" */
00311                               INTSXP, n)), p, n);
00312     if (order)
00313         Memcpy(INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, install("q"),
00314                                   INTSXP, n)), S->q, n);
00315     cs_nfree(N);
00316     cs_sfree(S);
00317     cs_free(p);
00318     UNPROTECT(1);
00319     return set_factors(Ap, ans, "LU");
00320 }
00321 
00322 SEXP dgCMatrix_matrix_solve(SEXP Ap, SEXP b)
00323 {
00324     /* b is dense or NULL [ <--> solve(A) */
00325     SEXP lu = dgCMatrix_LU(Ap, ScalarLogical(1), ScalarReal(1));
00326     SEXP qslot = GET_SLOT(lu, install("q"));
00327     CSP L = AS_CSP__(GET_SLOT(lu, install("L"))),
00328         U = AS_CSP__(GET_SLOT(lu, install("U")));
00329     SEXP ans = PROTECT( !isNull(b) ? dup_mMatrix_as_dgeMatrix(b)
00330                         : new_dgeMatrix(U->n, U->n));
00331     int *bdims = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(ans, Matrix_DimSym));
00332     int j, n = bdims[0], nrhs = bdims[1];
00333     int *p = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(lu, Matrix_pSym)),
00334         *q = LENGTH(qslot) ? INTEGER(qslot) : (int *) NULL;
00335     double *ax = REAL(GET_SLOT(ans, Matrix_xSym)),
00336         *x = Alloca(n, double);
00337     R_CheckStack();
00338 
00339     if (U->n != n || nrhs < 1 || n < 1)
00340         error(_("Dimensions of system to be solved are inconsistent"));
00341     for (j = 0; j < nrhs; j++) {
00342         if(!isNull(b))
00343             cs_pvec(p, ax + j * n, x, n);  /* x = b(p) */
00344         else { /* solve(A): (RHS) B = I_n,  hence  b = e_j (j-th unit vector) */
00345             int i;
00346             for(i=0; i < n; i++) x[i] = (p[i] == j) ? 1. : 0.;
00347         }
00348         cs_lsolve(L, x);               /* x = L\x */
00349         cs_usolve(U, x);               /* x = U\x */
00350         if (q)                         /* b(q) = x */
00351             cs_ipvec(q, x, ax + j * n, n);
00352         else
00353             Memcpy(ax + j * n, x, n);
00354     }
00355     UNPROTECT(1);
00356     return ans;
00357 }
00358 
00359 SEXP dgCMatrix_cholsol(SEXP x, SEXP y)
00360 {
00361     /* Solve Sparse Least Squares X %*% beta ~= y  with dense RHS y,
00362      * where X = t(x) i.e. we pass  x = t(X)  as argument,
00363      * via  "Cholesky(X'X)" .. well not really:
00364      * cholmod_factorize("x", ..) finds L in  X'X = L'L directly */
00365     CHM_SP cx = AS_CHM_SP(x);
00366     CHM_DN cy = AS_CHM_DN(coerceVector(y, REALSXP)), rhs, cAns;
00367     CHM_FR L;
00368     double one[] = {1,0}, zero[] = {0,0};
00369     SEXP ans = PROTECT(allocVector(VECSXP, 3));
00370     R_CheckStack();
00371 
00372     if (cx->ncol < cx->nrow || cx->ncol <= 0)
00373         error(_("dgCMatrix_cholsol requires a 'short, wide' rectangular matrix"));
00374     if (cy->nrow != cx->ncol)
00375         error(_("Dimensions of system to be solved are inconsistent"));
00376     rhs = cholmod_allocate_dense(cx->nrow, 1, cx->nrow, CHOLMOD_REAL, &c);
00377     if (!(cholmod_sdmult(cx, 0 /* trans */, one, zero, cy, rhs, &c)))
00378         error(_("cholmod_sdmult error"));
00379     L = cholmod_analyze(cx, &c);
00380     if (!cholmod_factorize(cx, L, &c))
00381         error(_("cholmod_factorize failed: status %d, minor %d from ncol %d"),
00382               c.status, L->minor, L->n);
00383 /* FIXME: Do this in stages so an "effects" vector can be calculated */
00384     if (!(cAns = cholmod_solve(CHOLMOD_A, L, rhs, &c)))
00385         error(_("cholmod_solve (CHOLMOD_A) failed: status %d, minor %d from ncol %d"),
00386               c.status, L->minor, L->n);
00387     SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 0, chm_factor_to_SEXP(L, 0));
00388     SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 1, allocVector(REALSXP, cx->nrow));
00389     Memcpy(REAL(VECTOR_ELT(ans, 1)), (double*)(cAns->x), cx->nrow);
00390 /* FIXME: Change this when the "effects" vector is available */
00391     SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 2, allocVector(REALSXP, cx->nrow));
00392     Memcpy(REAL(VECTOR_ELT(ans, 1)), (double*)(rhs->x), cx->nrow);
00393 
00394     cholmod_free_factor(&L, &c);
00395     cholmod_free_dense(&rhs, &c);
00396     cholmod_free_dense(&cAns, &c);
00397     UNPROTECT(1);
00398     return ans;
00399 }

00402 /* Define all of
00403  *  dgCMatrix_colSums(....)

00429 SEXP lgCMatrix_colSums(SEXP x, SEXP NArm, SEXP spRes, SEXP trans, SEXP means)
00430 {
00431     if(asLogical(means)) /* ==> result will be "double" / "dsparseVector" */
00432         return lgCMatrix_colSums_d(x, NArm, spRes, trans, means);
00433     else
00434         return lgCMatrix_colSums_i(x, NArm, spRes, trans, means);
00435 }
00436 
00437 SEXP ngCMatrix_colSums(SEXP x, SEXP NArm, SEXP spRes, SEXP trans, SEXP means)
00438 {
00439     if(asLogical(means)) /* ==> result will be "double" / "dsparseVector" */
00440         return ngCMatrix_colSums_d(x, NArm, spRes, trans, means);
00441     else
00442         return ngCMatrix_colSums_i(x, NArm, spRes, trans, means);
00443 }
